This WATERING PLACE is finely situated III

Wilmington, commanding All extensive view OF
tle surrounding country, the River Delaware and
tie ncighborng States. The grouhas Of tile
company afford pleasant and shady promenAdes,

and Baltimore, affords facility OF corhnmnlca-

An Enrlishman asked an Irishman il the roads
in ireland were good, yes said the lrlshnan,
so excellent that wonder you do not import
some Of them into England. We have the road
to love strewed with roses: the road to matrmo-
ny through nettles; the road Of honor through
duel; the road to prison trough the courts OF 'awi
and the road to the undertaker's through the
apothccary's shop Have you any road to pre-
ferment' No said the lrishman. not now
that road, since the Union is removed to Eng
land, YOU pass through it to the kings palace,
ana am told that il is the dirtisst road in Great
Britain

full articles.headline: borough Aoan.
full articles.article:
TIE undersigned having been appointed by
the borough Council Committe to receive Pro
posals for Loan not exceeding $4,000 Dollars
on the credit Of the Borough of Wilmington
for the purpose Of supplying the Borough with
water, at Il rate OF interest not exceeding five
per centum rvr snnum, payable semi-annually,
and rembursable at the end of % years from the
4th Of July, l827-Notice is therefore hereby
given, that such proposals will now be received
BY the undersigned at any time after the present
date, fJr taxing sail Loan.


JAMES BROBSON,


JAMES GARDNER,


JOSEPH GRUDB,


NM. LARkIN,


Committee.
June l2th. 1897 SGT.

full articles.article:
The spacious and elegant house belonging -
.ne Company, which was completed la-t fall, Is
now open and handsomely furnished for The re-
teption OF visitors and boalders, under the su-
lerintendence OF the Subscriber.


This WATERING PLACE is finely situated III
The high and healthy country. live miles west OF
Wilmington, commanding All extensive view OF
tle surrounding country, the River Delaware and
tie ncighborng States. The grouhas Of tile
company afford pleasant and shady promenAdes,
.nd are bounded by fine streams.


The virtues Of the Waters are those ofthc pur-
est Chaly ybeate, according to the analysis or Pro
tessor Keating, of Philadelphia. They have been
particularly ehcacious in bilious and other H.
Sers, and are celebrated as fine tonic


The vicinity to Wilmington, offers at all times,
ACCESS to an excellent market, and the daily IN
tercourse by Steam Boat lines between that
place and New Castle, to and iloin phlaiel pha
and Baltimore, affords facility OF corhnmnlca-
tion not possessed by any other Watering Place
Parties can be accommodate At 4 short notice
with dinners, colatons, Ice creams, SC. &c.


No exertions shall be spared by the Proprietor,
20 CRAFTY every want Of tht visitor TO this pleas
ant and ssubrious Retreat


Charges will be moderate


CHARLES STANLEY.


June /, 1897. 35--3m.

roads, to the neighhoring towns villages, canal
&c Horses taken at livery G.. :.

An Enrlishman asked an Irishman il the roads
in ireland were good, yes said the lrlshnan,
so excellent that wonder you do not import
some Of them into England. We have the road
to love strewed with roses: the road to matrmo-
ny through nettles; the road Of honor through
duel; the road to prison trough the courts OF 'awi
and the road to the undertaker's through the
apothccary's shop Have you any road to pre-
ferment' No said the lrishman. not now
that road, since the Union is removed to Eng
land, YOU pass through it to the kings palace,
ana am told that il is the dirtisst road in Great
Britain
